result.execSummary:
The defendant Dane J Konkel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dane J Konkel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILE. OS

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to sentencing. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 15 days time served.  Served thru the Day Reporting Center.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court authorize electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* No contact with Antonio W. or Sara W.
* Complete 40 hours of community service.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dane J Konkel in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court vacates the warrant.

  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 8/12/2014 in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Dane J Konkel not in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  NO FILE IN COURT.  Matter in court for violation, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report received and filed with court.

CASE CALLED WITHOUT FILE.
Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also present in court is agent Abbehi Medrano. Due to the Violation Report the Court admonished the Defendant. State request some small amount of bail. Defense objects. Court will take the bail under advisement at the next hearing. Case adjourned for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 26.

Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hayes).  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with attorney Alejandro Lockwood for attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Karl Hayes.
BRANCH 3 FOR BRANCH 26.
NO FILE IN COURT.

Court address violation report, received and filed on today's date.  Defendant tested postive for Cocaine and THC.  Defendant warned that Court will modify bail if defendant continues to test positive.  Court also increases defendant's supervision with Justice Point to enhanced.  Case remains scheduled for scheduling conference on 4/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 26.  aw
Violation Report received and filed with court.

Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with Joseph Reipenow, student intern under the supervision of attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/1/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dane J Konkel in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dane J Konkel in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
